ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 116
ygData.msgSnippet: ... That is sick.  I can t belive folks would do that.  And then when you get to 14 they will be begging you to group to get SOW s.  Heck I had folks tell me
ygData.messageBody:
> I envy you being a 14 lv druid, when I tell people I am ONLY lv 6,
> nobody wants to group with me! :(

That is sick. I can't belive folks would do that. And then when you
get to 14 they will be begging you to group to get SOW's. Heck I had
folks tell me to dump my husband ( the only one I really group with now
) and group with them and then have a fit when I tell them no.

> As far as grouping, I have only been in 3 different groups for any
> length of time (1-6 hours)
> The first group didn't know what they were doing. Of course, neither
> did I but they abandoned me in Lesser Feydark AND didn't split the >loot fair

OW!!! Then they wounder why you don't want to group with them or why
you want to loot to. I have gotten "why do you want it, you can't use
it" I tell them to sell so I can buy those great spells you want me to
cast on you.

> The second group I was with was great! They were mostly lowbies (more
> experienced players with fairly low level characters). Lots of fun, >and they really helped me out with strategies and not getting lost >(dumb blonde syndrome!) I don't believe in twinking (sp?) but it is >nice to get advice from more experienced folks.

*giggles* I'm have red hair and I get lost all them time. Got lost big
time in Lavastorm the other night. All I can say is that the Wood Queen
( can't remember the goddess of druids name ) for SOW and Lev.


> My advice for grouping-make sure everyone agrees on plan of action
> before you start-including where to go, what to hunt, any quests >people are on, and order of looting.
>
That is the best advice I have heard in a long time. And I'll give one
too. When someone new comes into a group and you have broken the spawn
( ex - the small Drev camp in North Ro ) Don't get talked into moving by
them. I have died more times because the others wanted to follow a fool
like that.


Ranalla the Lost Druid of Prexus
